necator: <entryFree id="n30607" type="main" key="ne^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>neco</etym>, <sense id="n30607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slayer, a murderer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 18, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
necatrix: <entryFree id="n30608" type="main" key="ne^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>necator</etym>, <sense id="n30608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who slays</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Cons. Evang. 13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Cons. Evang. 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
necdum: <entryFree id="n30609" type="main" key="necdum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necdum</orth>, v. neque <sense id="n30609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
necepsus: <entryFree id="n30610" type="main" key="Ne^cepsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕcepsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕcepso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, Jul. Firm. 8), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythic astrologer in Egypt, a disciple of Æsculapius and Anubis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necerim: <entryFree id="n30611" type="gloss" key="necerim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necerim</orth>, <itype>nec eum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162:21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162, 21</bibl> Müll. (acc. to Müll. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=386" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 386</bibl>, a; erim is <case>acc.</case> for esim, from es = is).</entryFree>
necessarie: <entryFree id="n30612" type="main" key="ne^cessa_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. necessarius <sense id="n30612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
necessario: <entryFree id="n30613" type="main" key="ne^cessa_ri^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessārĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. necessarius <sense id="n30613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
necessarius: <entryFree id="n30614" type="main" key="ne^cessa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n30614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> necessarior, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Test. Anim. 4 al.</bibl>) [necesse], <hi rend="ital">unavoidable, inevitable, indispensable, needful, requisite, necessary</hi>: necessarium ait esse Opilius Aurelius, in quo non sit cessandum, aut sine quo vivi non <pb n="1195" /> <cb n="NECE" /> possit: aut sine quo non bene vivatur: aut quod non possit prohiberi, quin fiat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll. </sense><sense id="n30614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessarius et fatalis, opp. voluntarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: id quod imperatur necessarium; <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod permittitur, voluntarium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria conclusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges fatales et necessariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae sint ad vivendum necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatori necessarium est, nōsse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 41</bibl></cit>.—So without <case>dat.</case>, = necesse est: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tam necessarium quidem est male meritis quam optime referre quod debeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. ad Quir. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra ponere necessarium visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:216" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessariā re coactus,</quote> <trans><tr>by necessity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: quod tam necessario tempore ab iis non sublevetur, <hi rend="ital">time of need</hi> or <hi rend="ital">necessity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum longius necessario procederent,</quote> <trans><tr>farther than was necessary, too far</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res magis necessariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res maxime necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessarior medela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessarior sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Test. Anim. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessariores operas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cult. Tem. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid necessarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carn. Christ. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessā-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the necessaries of life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persae armis positis ad necessaria ex proximo vico ferenda discurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes sic adcensa uti ... sua necessaria post illius honorem ducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 14, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n30614.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">necessariae partes,</quote> <trans><tr>the private parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=193" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30614.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, connected with another by natural or moral ties (of blood, friendship, clientship), <hi rend="ital">belonging, related, connected, bound</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30614.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: cum utrique sis maxime necessarius, Balb. et Opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A: victoria hominis necessarii, <hi rend="ital">of a friend</hi>, Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans><tr>of a father-in-law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a latronibus redimeret necessarias mulieri personas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: necessarius heres = suus heres, <hi rend="ital">the natural heir</hi>, who was in the potestas of the deceased (opp. to heres extraneus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:153" default="NO">3, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:156" default="NO">156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 16, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30614.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕ-cessārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a relation, relative, kinsman, connection, friend, client, patron</hi> (cf. necessitudo, II.; syn.: familiaris, intimus): necessarii sunt, ut Gallus Aelius ait, qui aut cognati aut affines sunt, in quos necessaria officia conferuntur praeter ceteros, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.; necessarius angustus, <hi rend="ital">a very near relative</hi>, Fragm. Jur. Civ. p. 86 Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Torquatus meus familiaris ac necessarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis necessariis, qui tibi a patre relicti sunt, me tibi esse vel conjunctissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female relative</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Vestalis hujus propinqua et necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerelliae, necessariae meae, rem commendavi tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 72, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n30614.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessārĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rare</orth>), <hi rend="ital">unavoidably, necessarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessarie demonstrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 29, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparato cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30614.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessārĭō</orth> (the most usual form): <cit><quote lang="la">necessario reviviscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum vivo necessario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod necessario rem Caesari enuntiārit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:80" default="NO">5, 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necesse: <entryFree id="n30615" type="main" key="ne^cesse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcesse</orth> (arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessum</orth>, <sense id="n30615.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: NECESVS, S. C. de Bacch. l. 4: <orth extent="full" lang="la">necessus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 119</bibl> Wagn. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 1</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 815</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">neutr. adj.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> necessis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 815</bibl> ex conj. Lachm.; cf. Munro ad loc.; elsewhere only <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habere</hi>) [perh. Sanscr. naç, obtain; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">e)nek-</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)na/gkh</foreign>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 424" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 424</bibl>]. </sense><sense id="n30615.1" n="I" level="1"> Form necesse. </sense><sense id="n30615.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unavoidable, inevitable, indispensable, necessary</hi> (class.; cf.: opus, usus est) </sense><sense id="n30615.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">esse</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30615.4" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subject.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edocet quanto detrimento...necesse sit constare victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est eam, quae ... timere permultos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: emas, non quod opus est, sed quod necesse est, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fit, quod necesse non fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est igitur legem haberi in rebus optimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 3, 29, § 70</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30615.5" n="b" level="4"> With <case>dat.</case> (of the person, emphatic): nihil necesse est mihi de me ipso dicere, <cb n="NECE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de homine enim dicitur, cui necesse est mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.6" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos necesse est ut petat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ita necesse fuisse, cum Demosthenes dicturus esset, ut concursus ex totā Graeciā fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:289" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 289</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc necesse est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque necesse est, uti vos auferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est semper, ut id ... per se significet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.7" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">haec autem oratio ... aut nulla sit necesse est, aut omnium irrisione ludatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum condemnetis necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel concidat omne caelum necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si necesse est aliquid ex se magni boni pariat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">habere</hi> (class. only with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">non habebimus necesse semper concludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo minus habeo necesse scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oppio scripsi ne necesse habueris reddere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non verbum pro verbo necesse habui reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non necesse habeo omnia pro meo jure agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 16</bibl>: necesse habere with <case>abl.</case> (= egere; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.): non necesse habent sani medico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—In agreement with object of habere: <cit><quote lang="la">non habet rex sponsalia necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:18:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 18, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Needful, requisite, indispensable, necessary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod tibi necesse minime fuit, facetus esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.10" n="II" level="1"> Form necessum (mostly ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n30615.11" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">subject.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras necessum est, quicquid habeo, vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: quod sit necessum scire, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen haec retineri hamata necessumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externa corpus de parte necessumst tundier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 933</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessum est vorsis gladiis depugnarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessum est paucis respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num omne id aurum in ludos consumi necessum esset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsorem capiti non est adhibere necessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:57:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 57, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.12" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicas uxorem tibi necessum esse ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30615.13" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde anima, atque animi constet natura necessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare etiam nativa necessum est confiteare Haec eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 377</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
necessitas: <entryFree id="n30616" type="main" key="ne^cessi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n30616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> -ātium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:89:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 89, 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>necesse</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unavoidableness, inevitableness, necessity, compulsion, force, exigency</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30616.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hinc exsistit illa fatalis necessitas, quam <foreign lang="greek">ei(marme/nhn</foreign> dicitis, ut, quidquid accidat, id ex aeternā veritate, causarumque continuatione fluxisse dicatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, etiam si naturā tales (i. e. feroces) non sint, necessitate esse coguntur,</quote> <trans><tr>by the compulsion of circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori cedere, id est necessitati parere, semper sapientis est habitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam necessitati dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitatem alicui afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. necessitas mihi obvenit alicujus rei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex necessitate aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac nescio an majores necessitates vobis, quam captivis vestris, fortuna circumdederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema necessitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 15</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitate me, mala ut fiam, facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">facere de necessitate virtutem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a virtue of necessity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3</bibl></cit>, n. 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 54</bibl>, n. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">quam cum pecuniam profudisset, et sibi nihil non modo ad cupiditates suas, sed ne ad necessitatem quidem reliquisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 25, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30616.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30616.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fate, destiny, a law of nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum ortus et obitus ... quadam ex necessitate semper eodem modo fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana consilia divina necessitate esse superata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vita, quae necessitati deberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut id fatum vim necessitatis adferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vis omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30616.4" n="B" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">plur. concr., necessaries, necessary things, necessary expenses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquis autem tribus virtutibus necessitates propositae sunt ad eas res parandas, quibus actio vitae continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae necessitatibus servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suarum necessitatum causa,</quote> <trans><tr>wants, interests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae necessitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitates ac largitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30616.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Necessity</hi>, <cb n="NECN" /> <hi rend="ital">need, want</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">famem et ceteras necessitates tantopere tolerabant, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pro honore acceptum etiam necessitatibus subvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim necessitatibus tantummodo nostris provisum est, usque in delicias amamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere necessitates aliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30616.6" n="D" level="2"> For necessitudo, <hi rend="ital">connection, relationship, friendship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nostram necessitatem familiaritatemque violāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam necessitatem possidet paternus maternusque sanguis,</quote> <trans><tr>bond of affection, intimacy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: equidem mihi videor pro nostrā necessitate non labore defuisse, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 5</bibl> (cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 354, 11</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n30616.7" n="E" level="2"> Personified: Necessitas, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of necessity</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*a)na/gkh</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">te semper anteit saeva Necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 19</bibl>; and v. clavus.</sense></entryFree>
necessitudo: <entryFree id="n30617" type="main" key="ne^cessi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>necesse</etym>, <sense id="n30617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">necessity, inevitableness, want, need, distress</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30617.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (in Cic. less freq. than necessitas; in gen. more antiquated; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 3</bibl>): calamitatis necessitudine inductus, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 354, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puto hanc esse necessitudinem, cui nullā vi resisti potest: quae neque mutari neque leniri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 170</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: an necessitudine, quod alio modo agi non possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 61</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 57, 171: neve eam necessitudinem imponatis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eadem nobis et illis necessitudo impendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitudinem alicui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:50:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 50, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30617.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a close connection</hi>, in which one person stands to another as relative or friend, <hi rend="ital">relationship, friendship, intimacy, bond</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique grammaticorum asseverant, necessitudinem et necessitatem longe differre, ideo, quod necessitas sit vis quaedam premens et cogens: necessitudo autem dicatur jus quoddam et vinculum religiosae conjunctionis idque unum solitarium significet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina necessitudinum mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancta necessitudinum nomina, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4, 2: liberorum necessitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam antea Jugurthae filia Bocchi nupserat. Verum ea necessitudo apud Numidas Maurosque levis ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiae conjunctionisque necessitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt mihi cum illo omnes amicitiae necessitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitudo et affinitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā necessitudine et summā conjunctione adductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonos viros ad tuam necessitudinem adjungere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum accusatore tuo satis justam causam conjungendae necessitudinis putant, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitudinem sancte colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritatis necessitudinisque oblitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput illud est ut Lysonem ... recipias in necessitudinem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 12, 1</bibl>; 9, 13, 3.—</sense><sense id="n30617.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a necessary connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus autem ... neque habebat aliquam necessitudinem aut cognationem cum oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:186" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 186</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30617.4" n="B" level="2"> Concr.: necessitudines, <hi rend="ital">persons with whom one is closely connected, relatives, connections, friends</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">petiit, ut sibi permitteretur revisere necessitudines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mother and children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remisit tamen hosti judicato necessitudines amicosque omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crederes Alexandrum inter suas necessitudines flere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis obsidum loco necessitudinibus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
necesso: <entryFree id="n30618" type="main" key="ne^cesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcesso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render necessary</hi> (late Lat.): nam cibus et somnus, nisi quod natura necessat, etc., Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:412" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 412</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necessum: <entryFree id="n30619" type="main" key="ne^cessum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcessum</orth>, v. necesse.</entryFree>
neceunt: <entryFree id="n30620" type="gloss" key="ne^ce^unt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcĕunt</orth>, <itype>non eunt</itype>, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 162 and 163 Müll.</entryFree>
nechon: <entryFree id="n30621" type="main" key="nechon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nechon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spice with which sweet things were kept from turning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necne: <entryFree id="n30622" type="main" key="necne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necnĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>neque-ne</etym>, <sense id="n30622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">or not</hi>, is used in the second half of a disjunctive interrogation, corresponding to -ne or utrum, and also without a corresp interrog, particle in the first half (usually in indirect interrogations, and without repeating the verb). </sense><sense id="n30622.1" n="I" level="1"> In indirect interrogations. </sense><sense id="n30622.2" n="A" level="2"> Without <pb n="1196" /> <cb n="NECO" /> a verb: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero, potueritne Roscius ex societate partem suam petere necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum ego erro, qui quaeram, utrum emeris necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum proelium committi ex usu esset necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc habeam necne, incertum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posset agi lege necne pauci quondam sciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipiat enim actionem necne ad eventum pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Spald. on 7, 3, 30: idcirco quidam, comoedia necne poëma Esset, quaesivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30622.3" n="B" level="2"> With a verb: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristo dubitat omnino, deus animans necne sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc doce doleam necne doleam nihil interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiat necne fiat, id quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeritur sintne di necne sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di utrum sint necne sint, quaeritur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30622.4" n="II" level="1"> In a direct interrogation (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt haec tua verba necne?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
necnon: <entryFree id="n30623" type="main" key="necnon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nec-non</orth>, <itype>also separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nec non</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕquĕ non</orth>, partic. of emphatic affirmation. <sense id="n30623.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">And also, and yet, and in fact</hi>, to connect sentences: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero non eadem ira deorum hanc ejus satellitibus injecit amentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque meam mentem non domum saepe revocat exanimata uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen illa non ornant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero Aristoteles non laudandus in eo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque non me tamen mordet aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30623.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">likewise, also</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">necnon etiam precor Lympham et Bonum eventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:5:9" default="NO">2, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non et Tyrii ... frequentes Convenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc mihi praecipue, nec non tamen ante, placebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum letale animalibus: nec non et in folio eadem vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratissima est et esca panicum et milium, nec non hordeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non etiam poëmata faciebat ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neco: <entryFree id="n30624" type="main" key="ne^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n30624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> necuit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 861</bibl> P.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> nectus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 33, 627</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 362</bibl> P.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. naç, disappear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/kus</foreign>, corpse, <foreign lang="greek">nekro/s</foreign>, dead</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to kill, slay, put to death, destroy</hi> (usually without a weapon, by poison, hunger, etc.; cf.: occido, interficio, interimo, perimo). </sense><sense id="n30624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: neci datus proprie dicitur, qui sine vulnere interfectus est, ut veneno aut fame, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">occisum a necato distingui quidam volunt, quod alterum a caedendo atque ictu fieri dicunt, alterum sine ictu, id. s. v. occisum, p. 178 ib.: necare aliquem odore taetro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum P. R. vinculis ac verberibus necavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>: securi <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:316" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 316</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspendiosa fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidissem nullos, matre necante, dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in ventre necandos conducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:596" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colubra necuit hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of impersonal subjects: hos pestis necuit, pars occidit illa duellis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 861</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 549 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">lien necat, renes dolent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices herbarum vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsi imbres necant frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 29, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hedera arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 243</bibl></cit>; cf. Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae flammas necant,</quote> <trans><tr>quench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to drown</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deducti ad torrentem necati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30624.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te coërces et necas rectam indolem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thwart, check</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 454" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 454</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">to worry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bore to death</hi> with talking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 43</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">occidis saepe rogando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 5</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
necopinans: <entryFree id="n30625" type="main" key="ne^co^pi_nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc-ŏpīnans</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc ŏpīnans</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <sense id="n30625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., not expecting, unaware</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et necopinanti (tibi) mors ad caput accidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:959" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 959</bibl></cit> (Lachm., nec opinanti): <cit><quote lang="la">Ariobarzanem necopinantem liberavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcŏpīnanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly, unawares</hi>: necopinanter, <foreign lang="greek">a)prosdokh/tws</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
necopinato: <entryFree id="n30626" type="main" key="ne^co^pi_na_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcŏpīnātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. necopinatus <sense id="n30626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
necopinatus: <entryFree id="n30627" type="main" key="ne^co^pi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc-ŏpīnātus</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc ŏpīnātus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unexpected</hi> (class.): desertae disciplinae et jam pridem relictae <cb n="NECT" /> patrocinium nec opinatum a nobis esse susceptum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necopinata bona perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec opinato adventu urbem interceptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in necopinatam fraudem labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necopinatum gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcŏpīnāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the unforeseen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diligenter necopinatorum naturam consideres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>.—A dverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum secretum ab tumultu petit, unde ex necopinato aversum hostem invadat,</quote> <trans><tr>unexpectedly, unawares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:27:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 27, 8</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcŏpīnātō</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc ŏpīnātō</orth>), <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si necopinato quid evenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem necopinato videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud novum malum necopinato exortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
necopinus: <entryFree id="n30628" type="main" key="ne^co^pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc-ŏpīnus</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc ŏpīnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (poet). <sense id="n30628.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., unexpected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necopina mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:778" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:188" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. ad Grat. 12</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n30628.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., not expecting, unsuspecting, careless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum accipiter necopinum rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">occultā necopinum (hostem) perde sagittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 596</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
necromantia: <entryFree id="n30629" type="greek" key="necro^manti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necrŏmantīa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ēa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nekromanteia</foreign>, <sense id="n30629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evoking of the dead</hi> to reveal the future, <hi rend="ital">necromancy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 35.—</sense><sense id="n30629.1" n="II" level="1"> Necromantea Homeri, <hi rend="ital">that part of the Odyssey in which Ulysses descends into the infernal regions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necromantii: <entryFree id="n30630" type="gloss" key="necro^manti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necrŏmantĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>necromantia</etym>, <sense id="n30630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">necromancers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necromantii sunt, quorum praecantationibus videntur resuscitati mortui divinare et ad interrogata respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 9, 11</bibl></cit> (al. necromantici).</sense></entryFree>
necrosis: <entryFree id="n30631" type="main" key="necro_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necrōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ne/krwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n30631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the killing, causing to die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:125" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necrothytus: <entryFree id="n30632" type="greek" key="necro^thy^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necrŏthytus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">nekroqutos</foreign>, <sense id="n30632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sacrifices to the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nectanabis: <entryFree id="n30633" type="main" key="Nectana^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nectanăbis</orth>, <itype>is or idis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nectĕ-bis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 19, § 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nectănĕbus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2, 2</bibl>), <sense id="n30633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nectanebus: <entryFree id="n30634" type="main" key="Necta^ne^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nectănĕbus</orth>, v. Nectanabis.</entryFree>
nectar: <entryFree id="n30635" type="greek" key="nectar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nectar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nektar</foreign>, <sense id="n30635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nectar, the drink of the gods.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim ambrosiā deos aut nectare ... laetari, arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 318</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 606</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34 al.</bibl>: nectaris ambrosii sacrum potare lyaeum, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:276" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 276</bibl>; as balsam, Ov M. 4, 250; <cit><quote lang="la">252: siccato nectare Vulcanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30635.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of any thing sweet, pleasant, delicious, <hi rend="ital">nectar</hi>.—So of fragrant balm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 732</bibl>.—Of honey: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae (apes) purissima mella Stipant et liquido distendunt nectare cellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 164</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of milk: quid meruistis oves...pleno quae fertis in ubere nectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of bread and milk: Picentina Ceres niveo sic nectare crescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:47:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 47, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of wine: <cit><quote lang="la">vina novum fundam calathis Ariusia nectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 384</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baccheum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>.—Of a pleasant odor: <cit><quote lang="la">et nardi florem, nectar qui naribus halat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 848</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop., of poetry: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare credas Pegaseium nectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nectarea: <entryFree id="n30636" type="main" key="necta^re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nectărĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. nectareus, II. B.</entryFree>
nectareus: <entryFree id="n30637" type="main" key="necta^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nectărĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nectărĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nectar</etym>, <sense id="n30637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to nectar, nectared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectareis quod alatur aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 707</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30637.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30637.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sweet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicious as nectar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:108" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 108</bibl></cit>: fontes, Claud. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 209.—</sense><sense id="n30637.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nectărĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">the plant elecampane</hi>, used for flavoring wine, which was hence called nectarites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19</bibl>. § 108.</sense></entryFree>
nectarites: <entryFree id="n30638" type="main" key="necta^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nectărītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine flavored with elecampane</hi>, v. nectareus, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
necto: <entryFree id="n30639" type="main" key="necto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">necto</orth>, <itype>xŭi, sometimes xi</itype> (cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 494 sq.), xum (<sense id="n30639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> nectier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>with neo, kindr. to Sanscr. nah, ligare, nectere, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/w, nh/qw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bind, tie, fasten; to join, bind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fasten together, connect</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30639.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30639.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: nectere ligare significat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">necte tribus nodis ternos, Amarylli, colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8</bibl></cit>, <cb n="NEDU" /> 77: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necte meo La miae coronam,</quote> <trans><tr>weave, make</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 8</bibl></cit>, so, coronas, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueum alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus talaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavàque caput nectentur olivā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodum informis leti trabe nectit ab alta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <trans><tr>to fold in each other, entwine, clasp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:329" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 329</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collo bracchia meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille venit variis florum dea nexa coronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit odoratos Elegeïa nexa capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 27</bibl></cit> (4, 7, 37): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui compedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Africus in glaciem frigore nectit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 48.—</sense><sense id="n30639.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to bind, fetter, confine</hi>, esp. for debt: <cit><quote lang="la">liber, qui suas operas in servitute pro pecuniā quādam debebat, dum solveret, nexus vocatur ut ab aere obaeratus,</quote> <trans><tr>enslaved for debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L L. 7:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L L. 7, § 105</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint propter unius libidinem omnia nexa civium liberata, nectierque postea desitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nexi soluti cautumque in posterum, ne necterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo anno plebi Romanae velut aliud initium libertatis factum est, quod necti desierant: mutatum autem jus ob unius feneratoris simul libidinem, simul crudelitatem insignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; v. also 2. nexus, II.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes">23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec carcerem nexis, sed caedibus civitatem replet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30639.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30639.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To affix, attach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex alio alia nectantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc genere causarum ex aeternitate pendentium fatum a Stoicis nectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30639.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bind by an obligation, to oblige, make liable, bind</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramento nexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pignori nexa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pledged, pawned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:22:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 22, § 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30639.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten together, to connect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum causae aliae ex aliis aptae et necessitate nexae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes virtutes inter se nexae et jugatae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectere dolum,</quote> <trans><tr>to contrive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas inanes,</quote> <trans><tr>to frame, invent, bring forward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canoris Eloquium vocale modis,</quote> <trans><tr>to set to harmonious measures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeris verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo jurgia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to quarrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras,</quote> <trans><tr>to make, contrive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia nectebant,</quote> <trans><tr>they thus conversed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:637" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 637</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nectus: <entryFree id="n30640" type="main" key="nectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of neco; q. v. <sense id="n30640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
necubi: <entryFree id="n30641" type="main" key="ne^cu^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcŭbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ne alicubi</etym>, <sense id="n30641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that nowhere, lest anywhere</hi> (not in Cic.). itaque faciunt lapide stratā, ut urina necubi in stabulo consistat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut necubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositis exploratoribus, necubi Romani copias transducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 33, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1059" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1059</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
necunde: <entryFree id="n30642" type="main" key="ne^cunde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc-unde</orth>, <sense id="n30642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., that from no place, lest from anywhere</hi> (Livian): circumspectans, necunde impetus in frumentatores fieret, Liv 22, 23, 10; 28, 1, 9.</sense></entryFree>
necunquem: <entryFree id="n30643" type="gloss" key="ne^cunquem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcunquem</orth>, <itype>necumquam quemquam</itype>, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 162 and 163 Müll.</entryFree>
necuter: <entryFree id="n30644" type="gloss" key="ne^cu^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕc-ŭter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for neuter, <sense id="n30644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neither of the two, neither</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4859</bibl> (p. 351 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
necydalus: <entryFree id="n30645" type="greek" key="ne^cy^da^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcydălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neku/dalos</foreign> (deathlike), <sense id="n30645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the larva of the silk-worm</hi>, in the stage of metamorphosis preceding that in which it receives the name of bombyx: <cit><quote lang="la">primum eruca fit, deinde, quod vocatur bombylius, ex eo necydalus, ex hoc in sex mensibus bombyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 22, 26, § 76</bibl></cit> (acc. to Aristot. H. A. 5, 19, <foreign lang="greek">ka/mph, bombu/lios, neku/dalos, bombu/kion</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
necyomantea: <entryFree id="n30646" type="main" key="ne^cy^o^mante_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕcyŏmantēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nekuomantei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the summoning of the dead to reveal the future</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri,</quote> <trans><tr>the descent of Ulysses into Hades, as described in the Odyssey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nedum: <entryFree id="n30647" type="main" key="ne_dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nē-dum</orth>, <sense id="n30647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> (lit. while not), <hi rend="ital">by no means, much less, still less, not to speak of</hi> (class.), used to indicate that whereas a certain thing is not, another thing can still less be. </sense><sense id="n30647.1" n="A" level="2"> With a preceding negation: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapes si siet Amator, numquam sufferre ejus sumptus queat: Nedum tu possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimis temporibus nec P. Popillius, nec Q. Metellus vim tribuniciam sustinere potuerunt, nedum his temporibus sine vestrā sapientiā salvi esse possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 35, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl>: nulla simulacra urbibus suis, nedum templis, <pb n="1197" /> <cb n="NEFA" /> sinunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne voce quidem incommoda, nedum ut ulla vis fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">vix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aegre</hi> in the place of the preceding negative: <cit><quote lang="la">vix in ipsis tectis et oppidis frigus infirmā valetudine vitatur: nedum in mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum vixdum libertatem, nedum dominationem modice laturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et aegre inermem tantam multitudinem, nedum armatam, sustineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30647.2" n="B" level="2"> Without a preceding negation, which, however, lies in the thought expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">erat enim multo domicilium hujus urbis aptius humanitati tuae, quam tota Peloponnesus, nedum Patrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe secundae res sapientium animos fatigant: nedum illi corruptis moribus victoriae temperarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30647.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-Aug.), affirmatively, <hi rend="ital">not to say, much more</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulationes etiam victis Macedonibus graves, nedum victoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>much more should they prove victors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintius, quem armorum etiam pro patriā satietas teneret, nedum adversus patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis mihi jam videbaris animi habere, etiam adversus solida mala, nedum ad istas umbras malorum, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta etiam legioni, nedum militi, satis multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—So, by transposition, beginning the sentence (very rare): nedum hominum humilium, sed etiam amplissimorum virorum, <hi rend="ital">not to speak of, I need not say</hi>, Balb. et Opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A, 1.</sense></entryFree>
nedyme: <entryFree id="n30648" type="gloss" key="Ne_dy^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēdymē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēdymus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">nh/dumos</foreign>, from which one does not easily wake</etym>, <sense id="n30648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 696, 5</bibl>; Inscr. Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 448.</sense></entryFree>
nefandarius: <entryFree id="n30649" type="gloss" key="ne^fanda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfandārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nefandus</etym>, <sense id="n30649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that commits a crime, criminal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas, nefandus. nefandarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nefande: <entryFree id="n30650" type="main" key="ne^fande_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfandē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nefandus <sense id="n30650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nefandus: <entryFree id="n30651" type="main" key="ne^fandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ne-fari, lit. not to be mentioned, unmentionable; hence</etym>, <sense id="n30651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impious, heinous, execrable, abominable</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. infandus): sperate deos memores fandi atque nefandi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wrong, impiety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: nefandum adulterium, Cic.
