Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 12</bibl> (al. nefarium): <cit><quote lang="la">nefandum vehiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandissima quaeque tyrannicae crudelitatis exercuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 116</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nefandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aususne es, nefandissimum caput? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfandē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impiously</hi>: multa nefande ausi, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 993</bibl> P. (dub: Dietsch. H. 1, 62, nefanda).—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nefans: <entryFree id="n30652" type="main" key="ne^fans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adjectival collat. form of ne-fas</etym>, <sense id="n30652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impious, heinous</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nefantia pro nefanda: Lucilius (Satyr. Lib. IV.): Tantalus qui poenas ob facta nefantia pendit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 14 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Menip. 83:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Menip. 83, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nefarie: <entryFree id="n30653" type="main" key="ne^fa_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nefarius <sense id="n30653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nefarius: <entryFree id="n30654" type="main" key="ne^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nefas</etym>, <sense id="n30654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impious, execrable, abominable, nefarious</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: impius, sacrilegus): homo nefarius et impius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarius Atreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntates consceleratae ac nefariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestum ac nefarium facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis et nefaria crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa commemorare nefaria in socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefario scelere se obstringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: nuptiae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:64" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a heinous act, a crime</hi>: rem publicam nefario obstringere. Liv 9, 34.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impiously, execrably, heinously, abominably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid nefarie flagitioseque facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarie moliri pestem patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarie occisus pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nefas: <entryFree id="n30655" type="main" key="ne^fas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕ-fas</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n30655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indecl., something contrary to divine law, sinful, unlawful, execrable, abominable, criminal; an impious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wicked deed, a sin, a crime</hi> (cf.: scelus, flagitium, peccatum). </sense><sense id="n30655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid non licet, nefas putare debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 2</bibl></cit>. 25; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officia tua mihi nefas est oblivisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurius, quem Aegyptii nefas habent nominare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl></cit>: nefas est dictu, miseram fuisse talem senectutem, <cb n="NEFR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, cui nihil umquam nefas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus nefas est ... deserere patronos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora viva nefas Stygiā vectare carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas atque nefas,</quote> <trans><tr>right and wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 505</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:87" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 87</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 18, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omne fas ac nefas,</quote> <trans><tr>in every way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas triste piare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa dolos dirumque nefas in pectore versat, Certa mori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex maculosum edomuit nefas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>adultery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omne nefas se parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum crede nefas animam praeferre pudori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <trans><tr>civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 507</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiens civile nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum nefas contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 22, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 20, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a wicked person, <hi rend="ital">a wretch, monster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinxisse nefas tamen ... Laudabor (i. e. Helen, as the destroyer of Troy),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 585</bibl></cit>.—Also inserted as an interjection, <hi rend="ital">O horrid! shocking! dreadful!</hi> quātenus, heu nefas! virtutem incolumem odimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">heu nefas, heu!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosne, nefas! omnes infandā in morte reliqui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequiturque, nefas! Aegyptia conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lavinia virgo Visa, nefas! longis comprendere crinibus ignem,</quote> <trans><tr>O horrible!</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">est nefas,</quote> <trans><tr>it is forbidden, contrary to law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30655.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n30655.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A horrible</hi> or <hi rend="ital">monstrous thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumenides Stygiumque nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 695</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:626" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 626</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:942" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 942</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30655.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impossible</hi>: levius fit patientiā Quicquid corrigere est nefas, <hi rend="ital">an impossibility</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">a)qe/miton, a)du/naton</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nefastus: <entryFree id="n30656" type="main" key="ne^fastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nefas</etym>. <sense id="n30656.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (opp. to fastus): dies nefasti, <hi rend="ital">days on which judgment could not be pronounced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assemblies of the people be held</hi>: fastis diebus jura fari licebat, nefastis quaedam non licebat fari, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 93</bibl> Müll.: nefasti dies notantur N littera, quod iis nefas est praetori, apud quem lege agitur, fari tria verba: do, dico, addico, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 1. fastus: ille (Numa) nefastos dies fastosque fecit, quia aliquando nihil cum populo agi, utile futurum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:29" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30656.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30656.2" n="A" level="2"> For nefas, <hi rend="ital">contrary to the sacred rites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to religion; irreligious, impious</hi>: QVAE AVGVR INIVSTA, NEFASTA, DEFIXERIT, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolibare dis nefastum habetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 23, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30656.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">wicked, profane, abandoned</hi>: homines ad hanc rem idonei; <cit><quote lang="la">nam istorum nullus nefastust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfastum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. crimen), <hi rend="ital">a wicked deed, abomination, profanity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quid intactum nefasti Liquimus?</quote> <trans><tr>profane, criminal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30656.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unlucky, inauspicious</hi> = funestus, ater (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille et nefasto te posuit die, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diem natalem ejus (Agrippinae) inter nefastos referendum suasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua terra sit nefasta victoriae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:456" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosi dies dicuntur tristi omine infames ... quos multitudo imperitorum prave et perperam nefastos appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30656.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hurtful, injurious</hi>: innocentiorem tamen esse marem (fruticem); <cit><quote lang="la">eaque causa est ne inter nefastos frutex damnetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nefrenditium: <entryFree id="n30657" type="gloss" key="ne_^frendi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nē^frendĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>annuale tributum, quod certo tempore rustici dominis, vel discipuli doctoribus afferre solent, duntaxat sit carneum, ut porcellus</itype>, Gloss. Isid.</entryFree>
nefrendus: <entryFree id="n30658" type="main" key="ne_^frendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nē^frendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. nefrens.</entryFree>
nefrens: <entryFree id="n30659" type="main" key="ne^frens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfrens</orth>, <itype>dis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ne-frendo</etym>, <sense id="n30659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot bite, that has no teeth</hi>: nefrendes arietes dixerunt, quod dentibus frendere non possint. Alii dicunt nefrendes infantes esse nondum frendentes, id est frangentes. Livius: Quem ego nefrendem alui lacteam immulgens opem. Sunt qui nefrendes testiculos dici putent, quos Lanuvini appellant nebrundines, Graeci <foreign lang="greek">nefrou/s</foreign>, Praenestini nefrones, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=163" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 163</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coeperunt efferre porcum castratum, quem nefrendum vocabant, id est quasi sine renibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. Antiq. p. 559, 32</bibl></cit>: porci amisso nomine lactentis <cb n="NEGL" /> dicuntur nefrendes ab eo, quod nondum fabam frendere possunt, id est frangere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nefrones: <entryFree id="n30660" type="main" key="ne^fro_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕfrōnes</orth>, v. nefrens.</entryFree>
negans: <entryFree id="n30661" type="main" key="ne^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. nego.</entryFree>
negantia: <entryFree id="n30662" type="hapax" key="ne^ganti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nego</etym>, <sense id="n30662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denying, a negation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde addunt conjunctionum negantiam, sic: Non et hoc est et illud: hoc autem: non igitur illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 14, 57</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. negatio).</sense></entryFree>
negantinumius: <entryFree id="n30663" type="main" key="ne^ganti^nu_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgantĭnūmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>negonumus</etym>, <sense id="n30663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">refusing money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basiola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 36</bibl></cit> dub. (Hild. negotinummius).</sense></entryFree>
negatio: <entryFree id="n30664" type="main" key="ne^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nego</etym>, <sense id="n30664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denying, denial, negation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negatio inficiatioque facti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 29, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30664.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a word that denies, a negative</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 32, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
negativus: <entryFree id="n30665" type="main" key="ne^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that denies, negative</hi> (post-class. for negans, privans, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">negativa actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">particula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 32, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:237" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 237</bibl></cit>; opp. confirmativus, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:457" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:127" default="NO">14, 127</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">negatively</hi> (opp. affirmative), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Dial. p. 548</bibl> </sense><sense id="n30665.1" n="(a)" level="5">; Boëth. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5, p. 359:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, p. 359, 9</bibl> Bait.</sense></entryFree>
negator: <entryFree id="n30666" type="main" key="ne^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a denier</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis et Minervae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
negatorius: <entryFree id="n30667" type="main" key="ne^ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>negator</etym>, <sense id="n30667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">negatory</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:2" default="NO">8, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4" default="NO">4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
negatrix: <entryFree id="n30668" type="main" key="ne^ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who denies</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae negatrices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>denying</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
negibundus: <entryFree id="n30669" type="gloss" key="ne^gi^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nego</etym>, <sense id="n30669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">denying</hi>, Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
negito: <entryFree id="n30670" type="main" key="ne^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deny steadfastly, to persist in denying</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">negitare adeo me natum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 50</bibl></cit>: perii; <cit><quote lang="la">vix negito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero, qui illi ostenderit eam, quam multos annos esse negitavisset, veri et falsi notam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fieri negites quae dicam posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 913</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex primo negitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 111:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 111, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuit negitatque Sabellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neglecte: <entryFree id="n30671" type="main" key="neglecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>neglego</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. <sense id="n30671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
neglectim: <entryFree id="n30672" type="hapax" key="neglectim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>neglectus</etym>, <sense id="n30672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 637</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
neglectio: <entryFree id="n30673" type="main" key="neglecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>neglego</etym>, <sense id="n30673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neglecting, neglect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neglector: <entryFree id="n30674" type="main" key="neglector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neglecter, slighter</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptorum dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Divers. 45:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Divers. 45, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neglectus: <entryFree id="n30675" type="main" key="neglectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from neglego.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30676" type="main" key="neglectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>neglego</etym>, <sense id="n30676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neglecting, neglect</hi> (very rare for neglectio, neglegentia): <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter haec res ne utiquam neglectui mihi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a somno moventium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neglegens: <entryFree id="n30677" type="main" key="negle^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĕgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from neglego.</entryFree>
neglegenter: <entryFree id="n30678" type="main" key="negle^genter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĕgenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>neglego</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> A. <sense id="n30678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
neglegentia: <entryFree id="n30679" type="main" key="negle^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĕgentĭa</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">neclĕg-</orth>, not <orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĭg-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>neglegens from neglego</etym>, <sense id="n30679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carelessness, heedlessness, negligence, neglect</hi> (syn. incuria; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): neglegentiā, pigritiā, inertiā ... impediri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in accusando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditia quae fugiat agrestem et inhumanam neglegentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare aliquem de litterarum neglegentiā,</quote> <trans><tr>of neglecting to write</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—So, me nomine neglegentiae suspectum tibi esse doleo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum duarum, quas ad me misit, neglegentiam, meamque in rescribendo diligentiam volui tibi notam esse,</quote> <trans><tr>brevity, coldness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam etiam neglegentia est diligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutorum neglegentiam accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam neque neglegentiā tuā, neque odio id fecit tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>out of disrespect, want of regard, to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerimoniarum auspiciorumque,</quote> <trans><tr>neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex neglegentia domini vacet (fundus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:51" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neglego: <entryFree id="n30680" type="main" key="negle^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĕgo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĭgo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">neclĕgo</orth>), <itype>exi, ectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n30680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf subj.</hi> neglegerit, acc. to the form of the simple verb, Aem. Mac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 366</bibl> P.; and id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 895</bibl> P.; also, acc. to the best MSS., <pb n="1198" /> <cb n="NEGO" /> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 1</bibl>, neglegisset; v. Kritz and Fabri, ad h. l.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nec-lego</etym> (qs. not to pick up, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">to not heed, not trouble one's self about, not attend to, to slight, neglect, be regardless of, indifferent to;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case> or an <hi rend="ital">object-clause;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30680.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., opp. to curare (cf. desum): <cit><quote lang="la">si mandatum neglecturus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculam judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem neglegebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglectis urenda filix innascitur agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30680.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erus quod imperavit, neglexisti persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem edicti obire neglexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30680.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Theopompo negleximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 16, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30680.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to make light of, not to care for, to slight, despise, disregard, contemn, neglect</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">despicio, sperno, contemno, fastidio): qui periculum fortunarum et capitis sui pro meā salute neglexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam pecuniam captam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:94:section=218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 94, § 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et bellum ita necessarium sit, ut neglegi non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass over, overlook</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se semper credunt neglegi, i. e. contemni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30680.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba verbis quasi coagmentare neglegat,</quote> <trans><tr>neglect, disdain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theopompum, expulsum a Trebonio, confugere Alexandriam neglexistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 16, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 37</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n30680.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With a foll. <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegens, ne quā populus laboret,</quote> <trans><tr>unconcerned, careless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 25</bibl></cit> (securus, non timens, Schol.).—</sense><sense id="n30680.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus tantummodo segnior fit, ubi negligas,</quote> <trans><tr>when you neglect him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30680.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">neg-lĕgens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">neglĭg-, neclĕg-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., heedless, careless, unconcerned, indifferent, negligent, neglectful</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30680.9" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: neclegens dictus est non legens neque dilectum habens, quid facere debeat, omissā ratione officii sui, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">improvidi et neglegentes duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam pater tam neglegens ac dissolutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socors alicujus natura neglegensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicis deligendis neglegentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum, officii, rei publicae, sociorum atque amicorum neglegentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum inimicorumque (= prae stupore haud discernens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenocinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus tuae neglegentissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Th. 31</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">circa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa deos ac religiones neglegentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post illa obtegere eam neglegens fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">alarum neglegens sudor,</quote> <trans><tr>that proceeds from neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentior amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:147" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegens sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30680.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with respect to one's fortune, <hi rend="ital">heedless, careless, improvident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sumptu neglegens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentia neglegens luxuriosaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 29</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">neglĕgenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">neglĭg-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">heedlessly, carelessly, negligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere (opp. diligenter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerunt et ferarum pelles, proximi ripae neglegenter, ulteriores exquisitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere pilam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:17" default="NO">2, 4, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentius asservare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 26, 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentissime amicos habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30680.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., neglected, slighted, disregarded, despised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsi inter nos abjecti neglectique simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra soluta neglectaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma viros decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 509</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglectissima progenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:146" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 146</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">neglectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly, negligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglectius incedebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 39</bibl></cit>, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
nego: <entryFree id="n30681" type="main" key="ne^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n30681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> negāssim for negaverim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 96</bibl>.—Lengthened collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">negumo</orth>: negumate in carmine Cn. Marci vatis significat negate, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.; cf. Herm. Doct. Metr. p. 614), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [for ne-igo, ne and ajo, q. v.], <hi rend="ital">to say no, to deny, refuse</hi> (opp. ajo, <cb n="NEGO" /> to say yes; v. ajo; cf.: abnuo, diffiteor, infitior). </sense><sense id="n30681.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: vel ai, vel nega, <hi rend="ital">say yes or no</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 473</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tu mihi aias vel neges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat quis? nego. Ait? aio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes ait, Antipater negat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ego id curem, quid ille aiat aut neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nunc aiunt, quod tunc negabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.— With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affirm that not, to deny that</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes negat, in eo positas esse fortunas Graeciae, hoc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici negant quidquam esse bonum, nisi quod honestum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nego, ullam picturam fuisse, quin abstulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quoniam</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">negat quoniam Jesus est Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Joann. 2, 22.—Sometimes two propositions depend upon nego, with the latter of which an affirmative verb (dico, etc.) is to be supplied: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique negant Caesarem in condicione mansurum: postulataque haec ab eo interposita esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negabat cessandum et utique prius confligendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille negat se Numidam pertimescere, virtuti suorum credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 6</bibl>.—Sometimes another negation follows, which, however, does not destroy the first: <cit><quote lang="la">negat nec suspicari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negato esse nec mu, nec mutuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem te negas infracto remo, neque columbae collo, commoveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30681.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf., they say I am not</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">casta negor (sc. esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:321" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe domi non es, cum sis quoque saepe negaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo negantur ibi ranae coaxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciconiae pullum qui ederit, negatur annis continuis lippiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30681.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30681.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deny</hi> a thing; <cit><quote lang="la">factum est: non nego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed posthac omnia, quae certa non erunt, pro certo negato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negaturum aut me pro M. Fulvio, aut ipsum M. Fulvium censetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negando minuendove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto enim domestica, quae negari possunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the proof of which can be suppressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videant servi ne quis neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:87" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 87</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negare non posse, quin rectius sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si negari non potest, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n30681.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deny, refuse</hi>: quicquam quisquam cuiquam, quod ei conveniat, neget, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl> (Trag. v. 448 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam reo cuiquam tam praecise negavi, quam hic mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam id obstinate sibi negari videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui impune negare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego me vinclis verberibusque nego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:80" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstingui primordia tanta negabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:532" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim negare tibi quidquam potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30681.6" n="b" level="4"> Se, <hi rend="ital">to refuse</hi> (ante class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obsecrat, Ut sibi ejus faciat copiam: illa enim se negat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30681.7" n="C" level="2"> E s p., <hi rend="ital">to decline</hi> an invitation: <cit><quote lang="la">invitatus ad haec aliquis de ponte negabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30681.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">poma negat regio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>does not yield, produce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi materiam bellatrix Roma negabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:321" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars ventis vela negare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to furl the sails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dextra neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:553" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa negantia ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>opposing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi membra negant,</quote> <trans><tr>his limbs fail him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 668</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30681.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deny any knowledge of, to reject</hi> (with <case>acc.</case> of persons; <cit><quote lang="la">eccl. Lat.): negaverunt Dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me negaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: Christum negantes, ib. Judae, 4.</sense></entryFree>
negotialis: <entryFree id="n30682" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭālis</orth> (sometimes incorrectly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>negotium</etym>, <sense id="n30682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to business, pertaining to affairs</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">negotialis (constitutio) est, in quā quid juris ex civili more et aequitate sit, consideratur (opp. juridicialis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 62</bibl>: (locum) negotialem, quam <foreign lang="greek">pragmatikh/n</foreign> vocat (Hermagoras), in quā de rebus ipsis quaeritur, remoto personarum complexu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 58</bibl>; cf. 3, 6, 57; 3, 7, 1; 2, 21, 3: epistulae sunt aut negotiales, aut familiares. Negotiales sunt <cb n="NEGO" /> argumento negotioso et gravi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Ars Rhet. 27" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Ars Rhet. 27</bibl> Mai.: causae, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
negotians: <entryFree id="n30683" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. negotior <sense id="n30683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
negotiatio: <entryFree id="n30684" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>negotior</etym>, <sense id="n30684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doing business by the wholesale, wholesale business, banking business;</hi> also in gen., <hi rend="ital">any business</hi> or <hi rend="ital">traffic</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">reliquiae Asiaticae negotiationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6</bibl></cit> 8, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 66, 2: negotiationes vel privato pudendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagaria et lintearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quis tabernae aut cuilibet negotiationi filium servumve ... praeposuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:71" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite facere domum Patris mei domum negotiationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
negotiator: <entryFree id="n30685" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who does business by wholesale, a wholesale dealer, a banker, a factor</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">institor, mercator): improbus negotiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercator an negotiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 26, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30685.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n30685.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trader, tradesman</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">trucidati negotiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercis sordidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestiarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:5:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30685.3" n="2" level="3"> NEGOTIATOR, <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Mercury as the god of tradesmen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 55, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30685.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A factor, agent</hi>, intrusted with the management of a business, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 65</bibl> prooem.</sense></entryFree>
negotiatorius: <entryFree id="n30686" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to trade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tradespeople</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>trading vessels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>that tradespeople had to pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 32, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
negotiatrix: <entryFree id="n30687" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>negotiator</etym>, <sense id="n30687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that carries on a business, a female trader</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n30687.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum testatrix negotiatrix fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FRVMENTARIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3093</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">LEGVMINARIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 935, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30687.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">she that brings about</hi> a thing, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
negotinumius: <entryFree id="n30688" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^nu_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭnūmĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. negantinumius.</entryFree>
negotiolum: <entryFree id="n30689" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭŏlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>negotium</etym>, <sense id="n30689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little business, small matter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit nescio quid negotioli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 616</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
negotior: <entryFree id="n30690" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n30690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to carry on business</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a wholesale business</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the banking business</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30690.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se Syracusas otiandi, non negotiandi causā contulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curius qui Patris negotiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus mercibus negotiatur aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:74" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30690.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to trade, traffic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29, 4</bibl></cit>; Col. praef. 12.—</sense><sense id="n30690.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To gain by traffic</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum negotiatus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30690.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n30690.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deal, traffic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animā statim nostrā negotiari,</quote> <trans><tr>to traffic with our lives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n30690.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To engage in business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspiciebam in quod me mare negotiaturus immitterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕ-gōtĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30690.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wholesale dealer, trader, banker, business man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negavi me cuipiam negotianti dare (praefecturam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30690.8" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a dealer, tradesman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MATERIARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 655</bibl></cit>, n. 476: <cit><quote lang="la">SALSAMENTARIVS ET VINARIARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4249</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratores ac negotiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiantes in basilicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: NEGOTIANTES VINI ARIMINENSES, Inscr. Rein. c. 3, n. 88 (a. p. Chr. n. 251).</sense></entryFree>
negotiositas: <entryFree id="n30691" type="hapax" key="ne^go_ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭōsĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>negotiosus</etym>, <sense id="n30691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a multitude of business</hi>, as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">polupragmosu/nh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
negotiosus: <entryFree id="n30692" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>negotium</etym>, <sense id="n30692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of business, busy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">negotiosi eramus nos nostris negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia negotiosa et molesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentissimus quisque maxime negotiosus erat,</quote> <trans><tr>the busiest, most occupied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid crudelitate negotiosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir negotiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 54" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcisā omni negotiosā actione,</quote> <trans><tr>attention to business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiosi dies,</quote> <trans><tr>business days, working days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Comically, transf.: tergum, <hi rend="ital">a back on which business is performed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">which receives a drubbing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30692.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>:<pb n="1199" /> <cb n="NELE" />  edepol, rem negotiosam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
negotium: <entryFree id="n30693" type="main" key="ne^go_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōtĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕgōcĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>necotium; cf.: negotium, quod non sit otium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll.; v. 1. ne</etym>, <sense id="n30693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a business, employment, occupation, affair</hi> (cf. munus). </sense><sense id="n30693.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">negoti nunc sum plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam negotiumst, si quid vis, non sum occupatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui deum nihil habere negotii volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 28, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremā parte muneris ac negotii tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensia negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnibus negotiis interfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium municipii administrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versari in negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emergere ex negotiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transigere negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotio desistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magno negotio habere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to regard a thing as important, of great moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>: est mihi negotium cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">I have to do with one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabar, quid hic negotii esset tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adparatus, quem flagitabat instans negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp. with reference to affairs of state: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum otium negotii inopia, non requiescendi studio constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicis adfinis fuit an maritumis negotiis?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in farming the revenue or in private commerce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—Of the management of domestic concerns: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suum negotium gerunt otiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare suum negotium gessit Roscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum negotium agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 125</bibl>.—So of trade, traffic: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum negotii gerendi studio contractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotii gerentes,</quote> <trans><tr>tradesmen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonius ampla et expedita negotia in tuā provinciā habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 33</bibl>.—Of a lawsuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30693.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30693.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Difficulty, pains, trouble, labor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita et hinc et illinc mi exhibent negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>give me trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic exhibui negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden egestas quid negoti dat homini misero male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis habeo negotii in sanandis vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum negotium est navigare atque id mense Quintili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium facessere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one trouble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium exhibere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere innocenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est negotii libertatem recuperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato Siciliam tenere nullo negotio potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minori negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid negotii est haec poëtarum, portenta convincere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: facili negotio, <hi rend="ital">with little trouble</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39:38" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39, 38</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">levi negotio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 10, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Aiex. 8, 4: plus negotii est, si acutus quoque morbus is factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30693.4" n="B" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pra=gma</foreign>, for res, <hi rend="ital">a matter, thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est negoti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid negoti est, quamobrem succenses mihi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptum negotium et Graeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl></cit>. —So of persons Teucris illa lentum negotium, <hi rend="ital">a slow affair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q.
