Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elinguem, tardum, inhumanum negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. in Sen. 6, 14</bibl></cit>. —As transl. of <foreign lang="greek">to\ pra=gma</foreign>, euphemism for sensual sins, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Thess. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Cor. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a negotio perambulante in tenebris,</quote> <trans><tr>some indefinable terror</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:90:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 90, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
negritu: <entryFree id="n30694" type="gloss" key="negritu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">negritu</orth>, an expression used in augury for aegritudo: negritu in auguriis significat aegritudo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll. [perh. from neger = niger].</entryFree>
negumate: <entryFree id="n30695" type="main" key="negumate"><orth extent="full" lang="la">negumate</orth>, v. nego <sense id="n30695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nehalennia: <entryFree id="n30696" type="gloss" key="Nehalennia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nehalennia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river-goddess worshipped at the mouth of the Rhine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2029 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2775</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3912</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neith: <entryFree id="n30697" type="main" key="Ne_ith"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēïth</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nhi/+q</foreign>, <sense id="n30697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian name of Minerva</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neleus: <entryFree id="n30698" type="main" key="Ne_leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēleus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nhleus</foreign>, <sense id="n30698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Neptune and the nymph Tyro, a king of Pylos, the father of twelve sons who were all, except Nestor, killed by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 689</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:552" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 552</bibl>; Hyg. <cb n="NEME" /> Fab. 10.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30698.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēlēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nelean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neleia Nestoris arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyliae Neleia mella senectae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the eloquence of Nestor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:459" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 459</bibl></cit>.—Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēlēĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Neleian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Nestor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec postquam dulci Neleius edidit ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 577</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30698.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēlēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nelean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nelea Pylos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 418</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 558</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30698.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēlīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Nestor, a Nelide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 553</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:338" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 338</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nema: <entryFree id="n30699" type="greek" key="ne_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nh=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n30699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yarn, thread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nema Sericum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl></cit>; v. nemen.</sense></entryFree>
nemausum: <entryFree id="n30700" type="main" key="Ne^mausum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmausum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmausus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Gallia Narbonensis, noted for its springs</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nismes</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30700.1" n="1" level="3"> Form Nemausum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30700.2" n="2" level="3"> Form Nemausus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Clar. Urb. 14, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3751</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2157</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmausensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmausiensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nemausis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 29</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmausenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nemausus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemea: <entryFree id="n30701" type="main" key="Ne^me^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neme/h</foreign>, <sense id="n30701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Argolis, near which Hercules slew the Nemean lion and founded the Nemean games</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Nemeae nec Olympiae nec usquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemeae sub rupe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemee frondosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvereā Nemeen effervere nube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:664" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 664</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30701.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n30701.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nemean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Vigil. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30701.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nemean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:421" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:421" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 421</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the constellation</hi> Leo: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:57:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 57, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 655</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30701.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmē^us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nemean</hi>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmē^a</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/mea</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*ne/meia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Nemean games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30702" type="main" key="Neme^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nemĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river flowing between the territories of Corinth and Sicyon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 15</bibl>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">nēmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nh=ma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a yarn, thread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trino de nemine fati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 690, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. nema.</sense></entryFree>
nemeonices: <entryFree id="n30703" type="gloss" key="ne^me^o^ni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmĕŏnīces</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the victor in the Nemean games</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemea, Nemeonices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nemesa: <entryFree id="n30704" type="main" key="Ne^me^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Belgic Gaul</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Nims</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 354</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemesiaci: <entryFree id="n30705" type="main" key="Ne^me^si^a^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕsĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Nemesis</etym>, <sense id="n30705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of superstitious people, who practised fortune-telling</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 7, 2.</sense></entryFree>
nemesianus: <entryFree id="n30706" type="main" key="Ne^me^si^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕsĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>—M. Aurelius Olympius Nemesianus, <sense id="n30706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman poet, born in Carthage, who flourished in the latter part of the third century of the Christian era</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Numer. 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemesis: <entryFree id="n30707" type="main" key="Ne^me^sis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕsis</orth>, <itype>is and ĭos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/mesis</foreign>, <sense id="n30707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of justice</hi>, who punishes human pride and arrogance; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Adrastea and Rhamnusia (v. h. vv.): ne poenas Nemesis reposcat a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecam Nemesin invocantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post aurem Nemesios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 251</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemesis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8, 41</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes identical with Fortuna: <cit><quote lang="la">DEAE NEMESI SIVE FORTVNAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 80, 1</bibl></cit>.—Acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 22</bibl>, Nemesis is <hi rend="ital">the Sun;</hi> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 23</bibl>, she is <hi rend="ital">Leda</hi>, who was removed to heaven after her death.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30708" type="main" key="Ne^me^sis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mistress of Tibullus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:59" default="NO">2, 4, 59</bibl>; cf. 2, 5, 111; 2, 6, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:73:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 73, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemestrinus: <entryFree id="n30709" type="main" key="Ne^mestri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmestrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nemus</etym>, <sense id="n30709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of groves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemetes: <entryFree id="n30710" type="main" key="Ne^me_^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmē^tes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmē^tae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul, in the neighborhood of the modern Spires</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 27</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30710.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmē^ten-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nemetian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio Nemetensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Or. ad Valent. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Or. ad Valent. 2, 21</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
nemetocenna: <entryFree id="n30711" type="main" key="Nemetocenna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nemetocenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Belgic Gaul, in the territory of the Atrebates</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Arras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:47" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:52" default="NO">52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemeturii: <entryFree id="n30712" type="main" key="Nemeturi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nemeturĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nementuri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of the Ligurian Alps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30712.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nemeturĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nemeturian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:22" default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:24" default="NO">24</bibl>. <cb n="NEMO" /></sense></entryFree>
nemeus: <entryFree id="n30713" type="main" key="Ne^me_^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmē^us</orth>, v. 1. Nemea, B. 3.</entryFree>
nemo: <entryFree id="n30714" type="main" key="ne_mo_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēmō^</orth> (<sense id="n30714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">o</hi> long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">short,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:83 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 83 al.</bibl>), ĭnis (but in class. Lat. nullius is used for the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, and nullo or nullā for the <hi rend="ital">abl.; gen.</hi> neminis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 106</bibl>; Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.; <case>abl.</case> nemine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:Tog. Cand. Fragm. 19, p. 242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. Tog. Cand. Fragm. 19, p. 242</bibl> Klotz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl> et saep.; <case>dat.</case> nemini, rare but class., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 24, 4</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ne-homo; cf. praeda for praehenda: nemo compositum videtur ex ne et homo: quod confirmatur magis, quia in personā semper ponitur, nec pluraliter formari solet, quia intellegitur pro nullo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">no man, no one, nobody</hi>: quem nemo ferro potuit superare nec auro, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 220 Vahl.): nemo me lacrimis decoret, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl> (Epigr. v. 3 ib.): quos non miseret neminis, id. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 174 ib.); so Cato ib.; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facio pluris omnium hominum neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum ex consularibus neminem tibi esse video, praeter, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (collegio) nemo e decem sanā mente sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo ex tanto numero est, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo de iis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium mortalium Sthenio nemo inimicior, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:43:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 43, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemine juvante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nemo est, qui possit corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo reperietur, qui dicat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:Fragm. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. Fragm. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 8</bibl>.—Nemo non, <hi rend="ital">every one, everybody, all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte adulantem nemo non videt, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo Arpinas non Plancio studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo potest non beatissimus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—Non nemo, <hi rend="ital">many a one, some</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">video de istis abesse non neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 28, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas leges ausus est non nemo improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by a negative following: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem deo, nec deum, nec hominem carum esse vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo umquam neque orator, neque poëta fuit, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut per biduum nemo hominem homo agnosceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hominem neminem pluris faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 55, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Nemo unus,</quote> <trans><tr>no one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo unus contra ire ausus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 45</bibl></cit>.—Nemo quisquam, <hi rend="ital">no one at all</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl>.—Nemo alter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 91</bibl>; and nemo alius, <hi rend="ital">no one else</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium enim cui illam commendem habeo neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30714.1" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinam neminem amo magis quam te,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30714.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a nobody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me moverat nemo magis quam is, quem tu neminem putas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30714.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30714.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj., no, not any</hi> ( = nullus): nemo civis neque hostis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 5</bibl> (Epigr. v. 5 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">se adhuc reperire discipulum, potuisse neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir nemo bonus ab improbo se donari vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 19, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30714.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things, for nullus (post-class.): neminem excepit diem, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 744.</sense></entryFree>
nemoralis: <entryFree id="n30715" type="main" key="ne^mo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nemus</etym>, <sense id="n30715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a grove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wood, woody, sylvan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">templum Dianae,</quote> <trans><tr>near Aricia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 259</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Aricia,</quote> <trans><tr>situated near the grove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:19:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nemorense: <entryFree id="n30716" type="main" key="Ne^mo^rense"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmŏrense</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. nemorensis, II. B.</entryFree>
nemorensis: <entryFree id="n30717" type="main" key="ne^mo^rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmŏrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nemus</etym>, <sense id="n30717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a grove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wood</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30717.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. mel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30717.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30717.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the grove of Diana, near Aricia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 25; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:261" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 261</bibl>, Vitr 4, 7—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">rex Nemorensis,</quote> <trans><tr>the presider over the sacrifices to Diana of Aricia</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig 35</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n30717.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmŏrense</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a villa of Cæsar, near the Arician grove</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl>, in Nemorensi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl>; cf. nemus I. B.</sense></entryFree>
nemoricultrix: <entryFree id="n30718" type="hapax" key="ne^mo^ri^cultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmŏrĭcultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nemus-cultrix</etym>, <sense id="n30718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that dwells in the woods</hi>: sus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemorivagus: <entryFree id="n30719" type="hapax" key="ne^mo^ri^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmŏrĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nemusvagus</etym>,<pb n="1200" /> <cb n="NEMU" />  <sense id="n30719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wanders in the woods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nemorosus: <entryFree id="n30720" type="main" key="ne^mo^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nemus</etym>, <sense id="n30720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of woods, woody</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Zacynthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 270</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">u(lh/essa *za/kunqos</foreign>, Hom. Il. 9, 24): <cit><quote lang="la">canes nemorosis montibus errant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 427</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 38, § 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30720.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of foliage, bushy, shady</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus nemorosā vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorosi saxa Palati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:815" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 815</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:595" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondibus nemorosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezek. 31, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nemossus: <entryFree id="n30721" type="main" key="Nemossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nemossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Aquitanian Gaul, the capital of the Arverni</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Clermont</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 419</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nempe: <entryFree id="n30722" type="main" key="nempe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nempe</orth> (often <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmpĕ</orth> in Plaut., e. g. Mil. 906, 922; Trin. 328, 427, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 77</bibl>), <sense id="n30722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [nam and enclitic pe; cf.: prope, quippe, quis-p-iam, etc.]. </sense><sense id="n30722.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., in strengthening or confirming an assertion, as that which cannot be disputed, <hi rend="ital">indeed, certainly, without doubt, to be sure, assuredly</hi> (cf.: nimirum, scilicet). </sense><sense id="n30722.2" n="1" level="3"> In laying down a premise or conclusion: non istam dicit voluptatem. Dicat quamlubet: nempe eam dicit, in quā virtutis nulla pars insit, <hi rend="ital">he certainly does speak of that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe incomposito dixi pede currere versus Lucili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe enim duo genera materiarum apud rhetores tractantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 385</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ... necesse est, nempe sequitur ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30722.3" n="2" level="3"> (Esp. in colloq. lang.) In summing up or explaining another's meaning, <hi rend="ital">no doubt, certainly, I am sure</hi>: nempe illum dicis cum armis aureis, <hi rend="ital">you doubtless mean</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 16</bibl>: nempe huic dimidium dicis, dimidium domi? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Nempe sicut dicis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 41</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30722.4" n="3" level="3"> In stating a notorious or obvious fact or truth, <hi rend="ital">certainly, of course, beyond question</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe ego mille meo protexi pectore puppes, i. e. as everybody knows,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe tulit fastus (Medea), ausa rogare prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:42" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater est mihi nempe biformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30722.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30722.6" n="1" level="3"> In questions, to ask a more precise or emphatic statement of something already said (cf. I. 2. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">Quid ais? Nempe tu illius servos es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe hic tuus est?</quote> <trans><tr>really?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Vivunt, valent. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Nempe uterque? <hi rend="ital">do you mean?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe negas ad beate vivendum satis posse virtutem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30722.7" n="2" level="3"> In replies, <hi rend="ital">certainly, obviously, of course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeii tertius consulatus in quibus actis constitit? Nempe in legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (urbe) tandem hoc disputant? Nempe in eā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:16" default="NO">12, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:70" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30722.8" n="3" level="3"> Ironically, <hi rend="ital">forsooth, namely, to be sure</hi>: respice oh mi lepos! <hi rend="ital">Cl.</hi> Nempe ita uti tu mihi es, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at avus nobilis. Tuditanus nempe ille, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: dat mihi filiam suam; <cit><quote lang="la">nempe quam alicui servorum ejus nupturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nemus: <entryFree id="n30723" type="greek" key="ne^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕmus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root nem-, distribute; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/mw, nomo/s</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ne/mos</foreign>, pasturage, and Lat. Numa, numerus</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">ne/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n30723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wood with open glades and meadows for cattle, a wood with much pasture-land, a grove;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wood</hi> in gen. (cf.: saltus, silva, lucus). </sense><sense id="n30723.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras foliis nemus Multis tempestas Sternet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos nemora silvaeque commovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl></cit>: in nemore Pelio, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 280 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">montium custos nemorumque (Diana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus arboribus densum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum avia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora in domibus sacros imitantia lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri fontis nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30723.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a heath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grove consecrated to a divinity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Angitiae nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 759</bibl></cit>.—Also alone: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕmus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the sacred grove of Diana at Aricia</hi>, where Cæsar had a villa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam pictam in nemore Dianae posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 33, § 52</bibl></cit>; v. nemorensis, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n30723.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora alta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 453</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 62, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 401</bibl>.—Also, <cb n="NEOP" /> <hi rend="ital">wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictum acervans nemore congesto aggerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1216" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nemut: <entryFree id="n30724" type="main" key="nemut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nemut</orth>: nisi etiam vel nempe, Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
nenia: <entryFree id="n30725" type="main" key="ne_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">naenĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (<case>abl.</case> neniā, dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:142" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 142</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funeral song, song of lamentation, dirge</hi>: naenia est carmen quod in funere laudandi gratiā cantatur ad tibiam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=161" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 161</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 482</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratorum virorum laudes cantu ad tibicinem prosequantur, cui nomen nenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absint inani funere neniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30725.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30725.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mournful song</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ditty</hi> of any kind: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceae retractes munera neniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: huic homini amanti mea era dixit neniam de bonis, <hi rend="ital">has sung the death-dirge over his property</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has buried, has consumed it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 3</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">nenia ludo id fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>my joy was turned to grief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30725.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A magic song, incantation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:29" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30725.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A common, trifling song, popular song; a nursery song, lullaby; a song</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum Nenia, quae regnum recte facientibus offert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicetur meritā Nox quoque neniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 28, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legesne potius viles nenias?</quote> <trans><tr>mere songs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prol. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">lenes neniae,</quote> <trans><tr>lullabies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 197</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30725.5" n="4" level="3"> Nenia soricina, <hi rend="ital">the cry of the shrewmouse when caught and pierced through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30725.6" n="5" level="3"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēnia</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of funeral songs, the dirge-goddess</hi>, to whom a chapel was dedicated before the Viminal gate, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
nenu: <entryFree id="n30726" type="spur" key="ne_nu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēnu</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nēnum</orth>, <itype>false read, for noenu and noenum</itype>, v. non <sense id="n30726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
neo: <entryFree id="n30727" type="main" key="ne^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root ne-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/w, nh/qw</foreign>; cf. Sanscr. nah = nectere</etym>, <sense id="n30727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30727.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtemen tenue nere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic stamina nevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:771" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nerunt fatales fortia fila deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcae fatalia nentes Stamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30727.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weave; to interlace, entwine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam mater quam neverat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 818</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc neverat unum mater opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:691" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se radices mutuo discursu nentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30728" type="main" key="Ne^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n30728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neobule: <entryFree id="n30729" type="main" key="Ne^o^bu_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕŏbūlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neobou/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n30729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a girl</hi> (so called after the daughter of Lycambes, the affianced bride of Archilochus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neocles: <entryFree id="n30730" type="main" key="Ne^ocles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕocles</orth>, <itype>is and i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neoklh=s</foreign>. <sense id="n30730.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Themistocles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 1 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30730.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕōclīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the descendant of Neocles</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Themistocles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30730.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Epicurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30730.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neocorus: <entryFree id="n30731" type="greek" key="ne^o_co^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕōcŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">newko/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n30731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a person having charge of a temple, the sweeper of a temple</hi>: hujus (Serapis) simulacrum neocororum turba custodit, Firm. Math. de Err. Prof. Relig. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Math. 3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Math. 3, 7</bibl>, n. 9.— </sense><sense id="n30731.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an overseer of a temple, who had to conduct and superintend the sacrifices</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2354</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neocretes: <entryFree id="n30732" type="main" key="Ne^ocre_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕocrētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neokrh=tes</foreign>, <sense id="n30732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division of the army of Antiochus, which was armed in the Cretan manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
neogrammateus: <entryFree id="n30733" type="main" key="ne^ogrammate^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕogrammatĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">neo/graptos</foreign>, <sense id="n30733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">new</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neomenia: <entryFree id="n30734" type="greek" key="ne^o^me_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕŏmēnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neomhni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n30734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the new moon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neon: <entryFree id="n30735" type="main" key="Ne^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. 2. Neo.</entryFree>
neontichos: <entryFree id="n30736" type="main" key="Ne^onti_chos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕontīchos</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neontei=xos</foreign>, <sense id="n30736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neophytus: <entryFree id="n30737" type="greek" key="ne^o^phy^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕŏphytus</orth> (in inscrr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">neofit-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">neo/futos</foreign>, <sense id="n30737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">newly planted;</hi> of newly converted Christians, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕ-ŏphytus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neophyte</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Haeret. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neoptolemus: <entryFree id="n30738" type="main" key="Ne^opto^le^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕoptŏlĕmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neopto/lemos</foreign>. <sense id="n30738.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Achilles, also called Pyrrhus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 263</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30738.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a tragedy of Ennius, the hero of which was Neoptolemus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <cb n="NEPO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:16:5" default="NO">5, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 281</bibl> (Vahl. and Rib. put these passages under Incerti Nominis Reliquiae). —</sense><sense id="n30738.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Alexander's generals, who was defeated by Eumenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neopum: <entryFree id="n30739" type="main" key="neopum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neopum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">olive-oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neoterice: <entryFree id="n30740" type="main" key="ne^o_te^ri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕōtĕrĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. neotericus.</entryFree>
neotericus: <entryFree id="n30741" type="greek" key="ne^o_te^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕōtĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">newteriko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n30741.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">New, modern</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. de Stat. Anim. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30741.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕōtĕrĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">modern writers</hi>, Aur. Vict. de Orig. Gent. Rom. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕōtĕrĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after a modern fashion</hi>: dicere, Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
nepa: <entryFree id="n30742" type="foreign" key="ne^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=164" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 164</bibl> and 165 Müll., an African word: Afrorum linguā est animal venenatum, caudā feriens, alio nomine scorpius, etc., Fest. l. l.</etym>. <sense id="n30742.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A scorpion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl> Madv. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n30742.1" n="B" level="2"> Nepa, <hi rend="ital">a constellation, the Scorpion</hi>: Capra aut Nepa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl> (Trag. v. 276 Vahl.): pectus Nepai, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 109; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:56" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 56</bibl>.—Collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:39" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30742.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cŕab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recessim cedam ad parietem imitabor nepam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 13, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nepas: <entryFree id="n30743" type="main" key="ne^pas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. nepa, I. B.</entryFree>
nepenthes: <entryFree id="n30744" type="greek" key="ne_penthe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēpenthĕs</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nhpenqe/s</foreign> (that drives away sadness), <sense id="n30744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant which, mingled with wine, had an exhilarating effect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 91, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2, 5, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nepeta: <entryFree id="n30745" type="main" key="Ne^pe^ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpĕte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nepi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 9</bibl>.—Collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpe</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30745.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpĕ-sīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Nepens-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nepesine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpĕsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nepesines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 9</bibl> and 10.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30746" type="main" key="ne^pe^ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, Italian catnip</hi> (Nepeta Italica, Willd.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nephela: <entryFree id="n30747" type="gloss" key="ne^phe^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕphĕla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nĕfĕla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nefe/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n30747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thin cake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefela, nucunculus, favus, subitillum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30747.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕ-phĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 359, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nephele: <entryFree id="n30748" type="main" key="Ne^phe^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕphĕlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <sense id="n30748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nefe/lh</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n30748.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Athamas, mother of Phrixus and Helle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 1</bibl>, sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30748.2" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n30748.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕphĕlaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nephelæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ram that bore away Helle and Phrixus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:56" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30748.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕphĕlēĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Nephele, Helle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:956" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 956</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30748.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕphĕ-lēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Nephele, Helle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 195</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30748.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nephelion: <entryFree id="n30749" type="greek" key="ne^phe^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕphĕlĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nefe/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n30749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> personata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nephritis: <entryFree id="n30750" type="greek" key="nephri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nephrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nefri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n30750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disease of the kidneys, nephritis</hi> [pure Lat.: renalis passio, renale vitium]: nephritis a renum languore nomen accepit: renes enim Graeci <foreign lang="greek">nefrou/s</foreign> dicunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig, 4, 7, 24</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nephrītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., affected with nephritis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nephusa: <entryFree id="n30751" type="gloss" key="Ne_phu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēphūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nh/fousa</foreign> (sober, temperate), <sense id="n30751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 416, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nepos: <entryFree id="n30752" type="main" key="ne^pos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (v. infra) [Sanscr. nap-tar, descendant; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)neyio/s</foreign>, nephew; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ne/podes</foreign>; cf. neptis, Germ. Neffe], <sense id="n30752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grandson, son's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">daughter's son</hi>: primo gradu sunt supra pater, mater; infra filius, filia. Secundo gradu sunt supra avus, avia; <cit><quote lang="la">infra nepos, neptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nepos quoque dupliciter intellegitur, ex filio vel filia natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1, 2</bibl>: Metellum multi filii, filiae, nepotes, neptes in rogum imposuerunt. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Pompeii ex filiā nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:263" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catonis censorii ex filio nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20</bibl></cit> (19), 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororis nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30752.1" n="2" level="3"> For neptis, <hi rend="ital">a granddaughter</hi> (ante- and post-class.): Ilia dia nepos, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 70</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 56 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 477, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 678, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30752.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30752.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A brother's</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sister's son, a nephew</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tres instituit heredes sororum nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60</bibl>, n. 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30752.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a descendant</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">filius an aliquis magnā de stirpe nepotum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nepotum Perniciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: Caesar, <pb n="1201" /> <cb n="NEPT" /> ab Aeneā qui tibi fratre nepos (to Cupid), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimos Remi nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 58, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tetigit tuos urtica nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30752.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A favorite</hi>: omnes profecto mulieres te amant ... <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> ... nepos sum Veneris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 50</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30752.6" n="4" level="3"> Of animals (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:5" default="NO">7, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30752.7" n="5" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">a sucker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:6:5" default="NO">4, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30752.8" n="C" level="2"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">a spendthrift, prodigal</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ganeo, asotus): quis ganeo, quis nepos, quis adulter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in populi Romani patrimonio nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profusus nepos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum simplex hilarisque nepoti Discrepet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30753" type="main" key="Ne^pos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Cornelia. So Cornelius Nepos, <hi rend="ital">a Roman historian, the friend of Cicero, Atticus, and Calullus; author of the work</hi> De Viris Illustribus, <hi rend="ital">a portion of which is preserved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:28" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 28, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nepotalis: <entryFree id="n30754" type="main" key="ne^po_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpōtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. nepos, C.</etym>, <sense id="n30754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extravagant, prodigal, profuse</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nepotatus: <entryFree id="n30755" type="main" key="ne^po_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpōtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nepotor</etym>, <sense id="n30755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extravagance, prodigality, profusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 35, 56, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl> (al. nepotinis).</sense></entryFree>
nepotianus: <entryFree id="n30756" type="main" key="Ne^po_ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕpōtĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nepos</etym>, <sense id="n30756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 423, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nepotilla: <entryFree id="n30757" type="main" key="ne^po_tilla1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpōtilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. nepos</etym>, <sense id="n30757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little granddaughter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 31</bibl>, n. 148.</sense></entryFree>
